Class SolidMechanics

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.physics.classical.matter.solidstate.SolidMechanics
public class SolidMechanics extends Object
Solid Mechanics equations (Stress, Strain, Elasticity).

Formerly MaterialProperties.

* @author Silvere Martin-Michiellot
Since:
1.0
Author:
Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Method Details

    • hookesLaw

      public static double hookesLaw(double strain, double youngsModulus)
      Hooke's law: stress-strain relation. σ = E * ε
      Parameters:
      strain - Strain (dimensionless)
      youngsModulus - Young's modulus (Pa)
      Returns:
      Stress (Pa)

    • strainFromStress

      public static double strainFromStress(double stress, double youngsModulus)
      Strain from stress. ε = σ / E

    • transverseStrain

      public static double transverseStrain(double axialStrain, double poissonsRatio)
      Poisson's ratio relation. ε_transverse = -ν * ε_axial

    • shearModulus

      public static double shearModulus(double youngsModulus, double poissonsRatio)
      Shear modulus from Young's modulus and Poisson's ratio. G = E / (2 * (1 + ν))

    • bulkModulus

      public static double bulkModulus(double youngsModulus, double poissonsRatio)
      Bulk modulus from E and ν. K = E / (3 * (1 - 2ν))

    • thermalExpansion

      public static double thermalExpansion(double length, double alpha, double deltaT)
      Thermal expansion. ΔL = L0 * α * ΔT

    • thermalStress

      public static double thermalStress(double youngsModulus, double alpha, double deltaT)
      Thermal stress (constrained expansion). σ = E * α * ΔT

    • bendingStress

      public static double bendingStress(double moment, double y, double momentOfInertia)
      Bending stress in a beam. σ = M * y / I
      Parameters:
      moment - Bending moment (N·m)
      y - Distance from neutral axis (m)
      momentOfInertia - Second moment of area (m⁴)

    • eulerBucklingLoad

      public static double eulerBucklingLoad(double youngsModulus, double momentOfInertia, double length)
      Critical buckling load (Euler formula). P_cr = π² * E * I / L²

    • brinellToRockwellC

      public static double brinellToRockwellC(double brinell)
      Hardness conversion: Brinell to Rockwell C (approximate).
